topics.title: AC Coupling and Amplification
topics.description: Discussion of how AC coupling allows the amplifier to operate.
evidence_quotes: But now we can AC couple a diode here only in the AC path using a capacitor here.
And now this voltage fluctuation can generate an AC current flowing through the diode.

topics.title: Amplification Gain
topics.description: Discussion of how the gain of a common emitter amplifier is determined.
evidence_quotes: So it becomes very clear that an approximation for the gain of any common emitter amplifier is the ratio between the collector impedance and the emitter impedance.

topics.title: Impedance Transformation
topics.description: Explanation of how the resistor transforms current into voltage.
evidence_quotes: So if I place a 10 times higher resistor here, I'm gonna have 10 times higher voltage here.
Because the resistor here is transforming the current on voltage.

topics.title: Inductor in Series
topics.description: Explanation of how an inductor in series with a resistor affects the amplifier.
evidence_quotes: I first placed an inductor in series with this resistor here.
Because this inductor here for AC will have very high impedance.

topics.title: Voltage and Current Fluctuations
topics.description: Discussion of voltage and current fluctuations in a common emitter amplifier.
evidence_quotes: Any voltage fluctuation here will generate a current fluctuation on this resistor here.
An approximation for the gain of any common emitter amplifier is the ratio between the collector impedance and the emitter impedance.
